TITLE: Input Validation for unchop() Function
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive error handling for various invalid inputs to the unchop() function, including non-data frame inputs, missing columns, and invalid parameter values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/chop.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unchop(1:10)
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unchop(df)
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unchop(df, col, keep_empty = 1)
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unchop(df, col, ptype = 1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Hoist Method Usage Example in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the use of hoist() function to extract nested data, showing how it provides a shortcut for mutate() + map() pattern when working with nested data structures.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
df %>% hoist(metadata, name = "name")
# shortcut for
df %>% mutate(name = map_chr(metadata, "name"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing tidyr Package in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows different methods to install the tidyr package: through the complete tidyverse installation, standalone installation, or development version from GitHub using pak.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
# The easiest way to get tidyr is to install the whole tidyverse:
install.packages("tidyverse")

# Alternatively, install just tidyr:
install.packages("tidyr")

# Or the development version from GitHub:
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("tidyverse/tidyr")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Validating Inputs for Extract Function in R
DESCRIPTION: These tests check various input validation scenarios for the extract() function, including missing required parameters and incorrect input types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/extract.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
df %>% extract()
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
df %>% extract(x, regex = 1)
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
df %>% extract(x, into = 1:3)
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
df %>% extract(x, into = "x", convert = 1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using expand_grid() with .vary argument
DESCRIPTION: Example of expand_grid() function with new .vary parameter to control column variation order
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
expand_grid(..., .vary = "fastest")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using extract() in R for String Extraction
DESCRIPTION: extract() is now 10x faster using stringi instead of base R regular expressions. It returns NA instead of an error if the regular expression doesn't match.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
extract()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Input Validation for chop() Function in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates error handling for invalid inputs to the chop() function, including non-data frame inputs and missing column specifications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/chop.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
chop(df$x)
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
chop(df)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using pivot_wider() with names_vary
DESCRIPTION: Example of pivot_wider() with names_vary parameter for controlling output ordering
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
pivot_wider(names_vary = "fastest")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Loading tidyr Package in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to load the tidyr package into the R environment using the library function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
library(tidyr)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Error Handling for Overwriting Existing Column in pivot_longer() in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests the error message when attempting to overwrite an existing column. It checks for proper error reporting and suggestion for using names_repair.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/pivot-long.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
pivot_longer(df, y, names_to = "x")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Debug Mode for separate_wider_delim
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to enable debug mode to diagnose issues with delimiter-based separation using too_few and too_many debug flags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/separate-wider.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
out <- df %>% separate_wider_delim(x, " ", names = c("a", "b"), too_few = "debug", too_many = "debug")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using separate_wider functions
DESCRIPTION: Example of new string separation functions for different splitting approaches
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
separate_wider_delim()
separate_wider_position()
separate_wider_regex()
separate_longer_delim()
separate_longer_position()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Size Validation in unchop() Function
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates error handling for size mismatches during unchopping operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/chop.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unchop(df, c(x, y))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Separating data with too many pieces in tidyr (R)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how separate() handles cases where the input data has more pieces than specified in the 'into' parameter. By default, it discards additional pieces and issues a warning.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/separate.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
separate(df, x, c("x", "y"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Verifying Column Length Mismatch Error in R's unnest() Function
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests unnest() with multiple columns of different lengths. It expects an error message indicating that the input sizes can't be recycled.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/unnest.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
unnest(df, c(x, y))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using full_seq() in R for Expanding Data
DESCRIPTION: The full_seq() function creates a full sequence of values from min(x) to max(x) at specified intervals. It's used within expand() for creating expanded data frames.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
full_seq(x, period)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using fill() in R for Filling NULL Values
DESCRIPTION: The fill() function now fills in NULL values in list-columns and can fill either upwards or downwards based on the direction argument.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
fill(direction = "up")
fill(direction = "down")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Error for Mixed Vector and Data Frame Input in R's unnest() Function
DESCRIPTION: This snippet verifies that unnest() raises an error when trying to combine incompatible data types (double and tbl_df) in the input column.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/unnest.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
unnest(df, x)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Explicit Variable Reference in drop_na()
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to explicitly reference variables in tidyselect context using the !! operator.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
x <- 2
drop_na(df, 2)     # Works fine
drop_na(df, x)     # Object 'x' not found
drop_na(df, !! x)  # Works as if you had supplied 2
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Length Requirements for replace_na Function in R
DESCRIPTION: This test verifies that the replacement value in replace_na() must be length 1, not a vector of a different length.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/replace_na.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
replace_na(1, 1:10)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Extract Function with Stringr Modifier Functions in R
DESCRIPTION: This test verifies that the extract() function raises an error when stringr modifier functions are used in the regex parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/extract.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
extract(df, x, "x", regex = regex)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Advanced Pivot Longer Pattern Matching in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows three different ways to use pivot_longer() with pattern matching: using names_pattern, names_sep with name column, and names_sep with .value special name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
df <- tibble(id = 1:3, x_1 = 1:3, x_2 = 4:6)
df %>% pivot_longer(-id, names_pattern = "(.)_.")
df %>% pivot_longer(-id, names_sep = "_", names_to = c("name", NA))
df %>% pivot_longer(-id, names_sep = "_", names_to = c(".value", NA))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring gather() in R for Key Column Storage
DESCRIPTION: gather() now stores the key column as character by default. To revert to using a factor (preserving column ordering), use key_factor = TRUE.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
gather(key_factor = TRUE)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Separating data with too few pieces in tidyr (R)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how separate() handles cases where the input data has fewer pieces than specified in the 'into' parameter. By default, it fills missing pieces with NA values and issues a warning.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/separate.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
separate(df, x, c("x", "y", "z"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Error Handling for Names_ptypes in pivot_longer() in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests the error message when names_ptypes is provided and there's a type mismatch. It ensures that the error message uses names_to names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/pivot-long.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
pivot_longer(df, cols = x, names_to = "name", names_ptypes = double())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing unpack() Single Column Duplication in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows error handling for duplicate names within a single column being unpacked.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/pack.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unpack(df, x)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Input Validation for replace Parameter in replace_na Function in R
DESCRIPTION: This test verifies that the replace parameter must be a list when replacing values in a data frame, not a single value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/replace_na.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
replace_na(df, replace = 1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Demonstrating fill() with .by argument
DESCRIPTION: Example showing new .by argument usage in fill() function for group-wise operations
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
fill(.by = group_column)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Invalid na.rm Parameter in unite()
DESCRIPTION: Shows error handling when the 'na.rm' parameter is not a boolean value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/unite.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unite(df, "z", x:y, na.rm = 1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Type Compatibility for Single Value in replace_na Function in R
DESCRIPTION: This test verifies that the replacement value must be castable to the same type as the data without precision loss.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/replace_na.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
replace_na(x, 1.5)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Nest Function with Grouped Data Frames in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows that `.by` is not allowed when nesting grouped data frames.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/nest.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
nest(df, .by = x)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Data Frame Column in Hoist Function (R)
DESCRIPTION: Tests the error thrown when attempting to hoist from a data frame column instead of a list.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/hoist.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
hoist(df, a, xx = 1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using nesting() and crossing() in R for Data Frame Creation
DESCRIPTION: nesting() and crossing() functions allow creation of nested and crossed data frames from individual vectors. crossing() is similar to base::expand.grid().
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
nesting()
crossing()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing expand() with Name Repair in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the use of expand() function with duplicate column names, showing how the .name_repair parameter handles naming conflicts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/expand.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
out <- df %>% expand(x = x, x = x, .name_repair = "unique")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing crossing() with Invalid Input in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests the crossing() function with an invalid input (a symbol instead of a vector) to ensure proper error handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/expand.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
crossing(x = 1:10, y = quote(a))
```

TITLE: Validating Input in Hoist Function (R)
DESCRIPTION: Shows various input validation checks in the hoist() function, including non-list column, unnamed elements, and duplicate names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/hoist.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
df %>% hoist(y)
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
df %>% hoist(x, 1)
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
df %>% hoist(x, a = "a", a = "b")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Invalid .value Column Type in check_pivot_spec (R)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests the `check_pivot_spec` function with a spec where the .value column is not a character vector. It expects an error message indicating that spec$.value must be a character vector.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/pivot.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
check_pivot_spec(df)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking Duplicate Column Names in Nest Function (R)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests the `nest()` function's error handling when attempting to overwrite an existing column.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/nest.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
nest(df, x = y)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Position-based Separation Error Handling
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates error handling in separate_wider_position when input strings don't match expected widths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/separate-wider.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
df %>% separate_wider_position(x, widths = c(a = 2, b = 1))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Invalid After Parameter in df_append
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the error thrown when attempting to use a decimal number (1.5) for the 'after' parameter in df_append. The function requires whole numbers for the 'after' parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/append.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
df_append(df1, df2, after = 1.5)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Nest Function Renaming Errors in R
DESCRIPTION: These snippets test the `nest()` function's behavior when attempting to rename variables, which is not allowed in this context.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/nest.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
nest(df, data = c(a = x))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
nest(df, .by = c(a = x))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing separate_longer_delim Missing Columns Parameter
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates error handling when the required 'cols' parameter is not provided to separate_longer_delim function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/separate-longer.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
df %>% separate_longer_delim()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing separate_rows Input Validation for sep Parameter in R
DESCRIPTION: Test case demonstrating that separate_rows validates the sep parameter must be a string, not a number. When passed the number 1, the function throws an appropriate error message.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/separate-rows.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
separate_rows(df, x, sep = 1)
```

TITLE: Regex Pattern Separation Error Handling
DESCRIPTION: Shows error handling for separate_wider_regex when pattern matching fails or capture groups are misused.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/separate-wider.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
df %>% separate_wider_regex(x, c(a = ".", "-", b = "\\d+"))
```

TITLE: Type Conversion Error in unnest() Function
DESCRIPTION: Shows error handling when attempting incompatible type conversion during unnesting operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/chop.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unnest(df, data, ptype = list(data = integer()))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing unpack() Renaming Restrictions in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates that unpack() function does not allow renaming of variables during unpacking operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/pack.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unpack(df, c(y = x))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Invalid Remove Parameter in unite()
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates error handling when the 'remove' parameter is not a boolean value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/unite.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unite(df, "z", x:y, remove = 1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Error Handling for Invalid Direction Parameter in tidyr's fill()
DESCRIPTION: Shows the error message when providing an invalid .direction parameter to fill(). The .direction parameter must be one of "down", "up", "downup", or "updown".
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/fill.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
df %>% fill(x, .direction = "foo")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing unnest_wider with names_repair Parameter
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the names_repair parameter to automatically resolve duplicate names, resulting in renamed columns with suffixes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/unnest-wider.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
out <- unnest_wider(df, col, names_repair = "unique")
```

TITLE: Basic Input Validation in unnest_longer()
DESCRIPTION: Shows various input validation checks including data type, required parameters, and parameter naming conventions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/unnest-longer.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unnest_longer(1)
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unnest_longer(df)
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unnest_longer(df, x, indices_to = "")
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unnest_longer(df, x, indices_include = 1)
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
unnest_longer(df, x, values_to = "")
```

TITLE: Testing Type Compatibility for Column Replacements in replace_na Function in R
DESCRIPTION: This test checks that replacement values for specific columns must be castable to the same type as those columns without precision loss.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/replace_na.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
replace_na(df, list(a = 1.5))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing separate_longer_delim Invalid Delimiter
DESCRIPTION: Shows error handling when an invalid delimiter parameter is provided (numeric instead of string).
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/separate-longer.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
df %>% separate_longer_delim(x, sep = 1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Pivot Longer Operation in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates pivot_longer() with names_to=character() to prevent name column creation. Shows transformation of wide data to long format while preserving id column.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
df <- tibble(id = 1:3, x_1 = 1:3, x_2 = 4:6)
df %>% pivot_longer(-id, names_to = character())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing order of ptype and transform application in col_simplify in R
DESCRIPTION: A test case that demonstrates that ptype conversion is applied after transform functions, which can lead to type conversion errors if transform outputs are incompatible with specified type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/unnest-helper.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
col_simplify(list(1, 2, 3), ptype = integer(), transform = ~ .x + 1.5)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using spread() in R with Mixed Column Types
DESCRIPTION: spread() now creates columns of mixed type when convert = TRUE. It also handles zero-length factors with drop = FALSE.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
spread(convert = TRUE)
spread(drop = FALSE)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Names Repair in pivot_longer() in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests the behavior of pivot_longer() when using names_repair to handle duplicate column names. It checks for proper renaming of columns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/pivot-long.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
out <- pivot_longer(df, y, names_to = "x", names_repair = "unique")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Non-Vector Input in Hoist Function (R)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the error thrown when trying to hoist a non-vector element with a specified ptype.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/hoist.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
hoist(df, x, "b", .ptype = list(b = integer()))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing full_seq Input Parameter Validation in R
DESCRIPTION: Tests that full_seq properly validates its input parameters. The function should error when period or tolerance are not numeric values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/seq.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
full_seq(x, period = "a")
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
full_seq(x, 1, tol = "a")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using complete() in R for Data Frame Completion
DESCRIPTION: complete() is a wrapper around expand(), left_join(), and replace_na() for completing a data frame with missing combinations of variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
complete()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Analyzing Download Statistics for Tidyr's Problematic Reverse Dependencies in R
DESCRIPTION: This code extracts package names from a problems.md file, retrieves their download counts for the last month using cranlogs, then calculates and visualizes download statistics to prioritize investigation of reverse dependency issues. It shows both tabular data with cumulative proportions and a bar chart of the top 20 packages by download count.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr/blob/main/revdep/revdep-downloads.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
library(tidyverse)

new_problems_path <- here::here("revdep/problems.md")
md <- readLines(new_problems_path)
pkg <- md %>%
  str_subset("^#[^#]") %>%
  str_extract("[[:alnum:]]+")

dl <- cranlogs::cran_downloads(when = "last-month", packages = pkg)

dl_count <- dl %>%
  count(package, wt = count) %>%
  mutate(package = fct_reorder(package, n)) %>%
  arrange(desc(package))

dl_count %>%
  mutate(
    prop = n / sum(n),
    cum_prop = cumsum(prop)
  ) %>%
  print(n = 20)
```
